dct:title: Miami-Dade Park Facilities
dct:creator: Miami-Dade County
Florida

The maps/data shown here are for illustration purposes only and are not suitable for site-specific decision making. Information found here should not be used for making financial or any other commitments. Miami-Dade County provides this information with the understanding that it is not guaranteed to be accurate, correct or complete and conclusions drawn from such information are the sole responsibility of the user. dct:description: A point feature class of all park facilities (County, Municipal, State or National) within Miami-Dade County. This layer was created merging the County Parks, Municipal Parks, State and Federal parks feature classes.
prov:qualifiedAttribution: This layer was created merging the County Parks, Municipal Parks, State and Federal parks feature classes.
prov:action:
#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/mdc_park_facilities/{download,etl} && cd /data/mdc_park_facilities

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  wget -O download/mdc_park_facilities.json 'https://gisweb.miamidade.gov/arcgis/rest/services/Parks/MD_Parks305/MapServer/0/query?where=1%3D1&outFields=*&outSR=4326&f=json'

# replace column names Shape__Length and Shape__Area to avoid conflict when
# providing as service on ArcServer.
sed -i 's/Shape__Length/shape_length/gI; s/Shape__Area/shape_area/gI' download/mdc_park_facilities.json

# load into postGIS with:
  ogr2ogr -lco GEOMETRY_NAME=geom -f PostgreSQL PG:"<postgres connection>" download/mdc_park_facilities.json -nlt point -nln mdc_park_facilities

#########
# Step 2 - SQL script (pseudo code):
####

# remove duplicate points and make geometries valid:
UPDATE mdc_park_facilities
  SET geom=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(geom));"

# add local geometry column and reproject existing geometries into local EPSG:
SELECT AddGeometryColumn (
  'mdc_park_facilities',
  'geom_local',2236,'point',2
);
UPDATE mdc_park_facilities
  SET geom_local=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(ST_Transform(geom,2236)));
CREATE INDEX mdc_park_facilities_geom_local_idx
  ON mdc_park_facilities
  USING GIST (geom_local);
NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';"cd /data/mdc_park_facilities/
mkdir -p derived
# Create pg_dump and downloadable zip of table in derivate directory 
pg_dump -d $POSTGRES_DB -U $POSTGRES_USER -p $POSTGRES_PORT -h postgis-59d6xi0arxi5dcwr -t mdc_park_facilities > derived/mdc_park_facilities.sql
tar -czf derived/mdc_park_facilities.sql.tar.gz meta_dcat_mdc_park_facilities.json -C derived mdc_park_facilities.sql
